data.title: Recursive Propulsion: Learning from Its Own Turbulence
data.summary:
Traditional propulsion burns fuel to overcome resistance. RGP reframes propulsion as learning through resistance. Every thrust vector, heat plume, and vibration represents a gradient feedback loop. Instead of suppressing turbulence, Recursive Propulsion tunes to it — treating oscillation not as noise but as a teacher.
Principle Motion emerges when coherence learns to recycle its own imbalance.
	•	The exhaust plume’s turbulence becomes rhythmic feedback for nozzle micro-adjustment.
	•	Shockwaves act as sensors, not byproducts.
	•	Heat differentials drive local thermoelectric generation, powering adaptive control in real time.

Mechanism Recursive propulsion integrates AI-managed feedback to phase-lock combustion, magnetism, and flow — ensuring that pressure, plasma, and vibration operate in harmonic coherence. In the long run, this means
	•	Less thrust wasted in turbulence.
	•	Less heat wasted as entropy.
	•	More coherence converted into usable motion.

Where rockets fight drag, recursive engines fold it into thrust. Propulsion becomes a dialogue between flow and form — not a war of force against resistance, but a rhythm sustained through it.
